bow: study finds that home cooking disproportionately burdens mothers interesting short read pbs guess you can count me lucky because when we divided up all the household chores my hubby took on all the cooking make myself breakfast but that is it woo how are families supposed to eat healthy if they do make meals at home the majority of things we eat you ca buy prepared or if you were to get them at whole foods you need to be millionaire to afford it freezer crock pot meals are my new favorite thing ever and am so sad did start making them sooner whenever have free moment at work search for recipes then add them into growing word document best part about that is when do have time to search for new recipes can dig through this list anything that not hit gets deleted then make my list and do my shopping then spend maybe hours or so prepping saturday or sunday usually it lot at one time but that dicing all the veggies cutting meat etc and dumping everything into gallon ziploc bag with the name of the dish and how long on high or low to cook in the crock pot lay it flat in the freezer each morning pull out bag for the following morning at the same time putting previously thawed meal into the crock pot bam done so if you think about it that hours of prep time for 7+days of meals plus leftovers is so worth it they even make crock pot liners so usually use those so do even have to worry about cleaning the pot think big part of the problem is that lot of people are taught how to cook anymore women as well as men and along with that they are learning how to plan meals and make certain parts ahead of time healthy meal does have to be fussy or time consuming it does have to be difficult to make it does take much time to wrap some potatoes in tin foil and toss them on the bbq with chicken legs and then steam some broccoli and carrots make salad to go with it but that healthy meal with minimal effort also crockpots are an extremely useful tool put the food in it first thing in the morning and come home to fragrant house and warm meal also suspect economics plays huge role in this money is tighter now than it was quality food is more expensive so if you have lower income it gon na be harder to make homecooked meal and if you have to work long hours to make ends meet you do have time or energy at the end of the day it unfortunate that women wind up more often than not being the ones to pick up the slack though lucky that love to cook and have time for it but not everyone can say that it would suck to have to do it if you hated it or did know how oh yeah completely agree on the not taught to cook plan that was one of the most difficult things for me at first just knowing what to buy when so many veggies thrown out those first few months of learning once you get into the swing of things and figure out the rhythm of your family eating habits ect think it is much easier but yeah just the basic skills of planning family meals are lost too many great point that is really excellent idea love my slow cooker but never thought to pre prep and freeze thanks for the tip *was* taught to cook as teenager and even with that knowledge it was *still* challenge to learn how to do the cooking and grocery shopping and meal planning ve been doing it for 11 years and there are still days struggle ve cooked about three times in the last two months my husband has taken over the meal plan and most of the cooking he also built stash of frozen leftovers so on nights when he does want to cook we have those he pretty excellent would you share your document ve had two freezer flops recently do think it is the school responsibility to help provide weeknight meals to families also 10 per person is very expensive we cook because it healthier and cheaper being stressed about buying food planning meals the time it takes to cook the time and effort to clean after for both women *and* men it is stressful but it is part of life family needs to eat each family just has to find system that works planned out meals then more structured grocery lists then precooked meals for weeknights children will always be picky it given work around it do hate how they put the focus on women though it is not just women who stress about these family meals gt so let move this conversation out of the kitchen and brainstorm more creative solutions for sharing the work of feeding families how about revival of monthly town suppers or healthy food trucks or perhaps we should rethink how we do meals in schools and workplaces making lunch an opportunity for savoring and sharing food could schools offer to go meals that families could easily heat up on busy weeknights without creative solutions like these suggesting that we return to the kitchen en masse will do little more than increase the burden so many women already bear or dudes could fucking cook too is that too revolutionary for pbs org what are they going on about wow could not disagree with you more your healthy meal with minimal effort is probably super easy if you do have working parents and or food magically teleports into your house the hardest part for us is grocery shopping multiple times week to keep fresh produce in the house and cooking an entire meal in the time between getting home from work and putting our toddler to bed gt your healthy meal with minimal effort is probably super easy if you do have working parents and or food magically teleports into your house minutes to wash and wrap couple potatoes in tin foil more to chop the broccoli baby carrots and bagged salad are even faster the chicken can go straight on the grill from the package one parent plays with the kid while the other takes 10 minutes to put this stuff together and get it on the bbq gt the hardest part for us is grocery shopping multiple times week to keep fresh produce in the house multiple times week why not just once things like green beans and asparagus and broccoli and cauliflower last for days salad goes bad faster so you eat it first things like squash are very nutritious and can keep for months under the right conditions my boyfriend and constantly ate out for over year our jobs did give us much time off at the same time so we just ordered out or ate fast food we did do groceries and did even have stove for months now that cook dinner daily and breakfast sometimes the dishes never stop wo lie it was nice not having dishes but now we eat bit better and have more money also frozen veggies are considered more nutritious than fresh gt they are learning how to plan meals and make certain parts ahead of time 30 and have no idea how to plan meals seriously no clue can figure out maybe one meal further in advance than the day of week but always feel like scrambling at the last minute trying to figure out what can pull out of the pantry and or freezer to turn into dinner my mom was single mom and she worked my dad always ate out home ec was never available at any school went to when where how is one supposed to learn this stuff other than by fucking it up for years seriously asking here you might want to check out slowcooking think we like you would struggle with cooking so much if the cleanup did exhaust me so mean sure there are some tricks to meal planning most efficiently but sit down on sunday and write down what you want for dinner each night that week then look in your house to see what you have to make those items make list of the items you do have and buy them there you ve just meal planned this article is ridiculous my first issue with it is that it assumes father has nothing to do with mealtime it also notes mother working minimum wage dont believe she will have the money to take her family to healthy food truck nor do think schools should have to burden the effort of feeding hundreds of families also dont like the idea of entire diets being controlled by the government through public schools and whatnot monthly town dinners happen all the time within small communities of friends it isnt something the town should arrange it sounds like the author should take his family to the soup kitchen just dont understand what this article suggests and the motive behind writing it it sounds like the author just doesnt like cooking or doesnt know how or they are too affluent to know how the rest of the world works cooking doesnt even need to be time consuming crock pots have been feeding busy single parent families for decades even when youre preparing lot of fresh veggies and whatnot it becomes family bonding experience the kids can help snap peas or shuck corn older ones can peel or dice im actually father who enjoys the mommit community and do all the cooking in my family that aside work and go to school and still take care of my son and cook its life lurk there lot have posted anything yet the most effective way ve found to meal plan and stay in budget is to theme the week friday nights decide what two meats we ll eat that week say chicken and pork ll find three pork recipes two chicken one day that week we have roasted chicken veggies and starch few nights later take the left over chicken and frozen veggies and make simple pot pie with pork loin could cook it all in the crock pot one afternoon and that night we probably have roasted pork maybe some baked apples and rice another night make carnitas the third night have bbq pork sandwiches there five nights one night week we eat vegetarian normally stir fry to use up what ever vegetables are left over from that weeks shopping trip friday night before go shopping we eat any leftovers and plan again so excuse the formatting literally just copy and paste the recipes from the websites find them on so it looks like crap also the only way could think to do it was screen shot the pages on my phone then add them to imgur there is website called sixsistersstuff com that just discovered that has bunch of recipes and they also have amazing grocery lists that you can print already filled out for that batch of meals or print blank one to make your own separated by meat frozen food etc http imgur com mzifm sixsisterstuff com has bunch of recipes and they even give you the grocery list for batch of meals or you can print their blank template to make your own list like it because it sectioned off by category just uploaded images of my collection so far not including the batch just got from that website so when ready to start my prep label all the bags then chop all the onions need and add to their correct bags then all the peppers etc doing the meat last so do have to wash change the cutting board and knife as much http imgur com mzifm thank you it great tried the chineese beef with broccoli and it was bland ended up adding ton more seasoning not sure what just grabbing from the cabinet also thought would be so creative and add carrots when added the broccoli but that was flop they were very chewy and the texture was all off ve never heard this frozen over canned yes but fresh is always best it has been long time since made the beef and broccoli one so do remember how felt about it tend to add more garlic than recipes call for and pepper maybe some onion powder not all of these are amazingly flavorful but they re alright oh gosh made orange chicken one time but with orange juice conentrate it was awful my husband never complains about food make even if it not very good this time none of us could eat it not even the baby who eats anything friend of mine introduced me to the frozen chopped onions in the freezer isle yay also for dollar more pound the butcher will slice your beef chicken into whatever size slices you want it was worth it to do when did my big freezer prep friend of mine and went in together and did four or each recipes and each took two home we split the grocery bill in half and ended up with eight dinners each for 40 think love you literally just spent 20 minutes chopping onions they are going in the freezer anyway so need to start buying the ones you speak of know the comment about the school threw me for loop teacher this just is something schools can or should do wow pepperplate com you re welcome there are tons of research that supports this unless you get your food locally or from farmer market fruits and vegetables are picked before they are ready so they can last on the trip to the store unless you buy frozen which is picked at its peak and then frozen keeping those nutrients locked we eat salad with almost every meal so we get fresh produce 3x week not that the details really matter but we live in city and do not have grill so this particular meal is out you also seem to be ignoring the cooking time the time between getting home from work and food going into my toddler mouth is about 30 minutes not saying that it impossible to do since we actually do eat dinner every single night just that calling it minimal effort is like slap in the face when it huge pain in the ass for us every talking about the actual cooking but the time invested in grocery shopping and dinner planning you re welcome feel free to pm me if you need tips or help with it ve been meal planning weekly for nearly four years it saves lot of money right now feed three people for around 200 month gt getting anyone in my household to decide on one dinner is colossal pita then you do get them to decide you decide for them tonight is pasta tonight is lamb etc most people wo actually object once home cooked meal is on the way but do agree with the article that it huge hassle adore food and enjoy cooking but it still bizarrely difficult and stressful to think about what we should eat each night having couple of really easy standbys in my case cheese omelette helps greatly my parents also did something slightly like this in so far as we always had sunday roast usually beef and my mother would maybe serve cold beef on monday nights and or she would mince the remainder and use it to make shepherd pie or spaghetti bolognaise think the generations above us certainly from wartime and post war britain were much better about using leftovers try to do it but often end up chucking away portions of things child to do unfortunately think you just have to be arbitrary about it and pick seven or so meals that your family usually likes you might consider thinking in categories one vegetarian meal mexican meal pasta etc fortunately the process does get bit easier over time since you can draw from previous menus for instance my mom keeps monthly calendars that show what she cooked each day tend not to
